intro: Walsholaria, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Walsholaria has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and adaptability to harsh environments.
